entry.pr: ˈhav, (h)əv, v; in “have to” meaning “must” usually ˈhaf

in.pr: ˈhaz, (h)əz, z, s; in “has to” meaning “must” usually ˈhas

entry.et: Middle English, from Old English habban; akin to Old High German habēn to have, and perhaps to hevan to lift heave

def.dt: :to hold or maintain as a possession, privilege, or entitlement they have a new car I have my rights
:to hold in one's use, service, regard, or at one's disposal the group will have enough tickets for everyone we don't have time to stay
:to hold, include, or contain as a part or whole the car has power brakes April has 30 days
:to feel obligation in regard to usually used with an infinitive with to we have things to do have a deadline to meet
:to stand in a certain relationship to has three fine children we will have the wind at our backs
:to acquire or get possession of :obtain these shoes are the best to be had
:receive had news
:accept
:to accept in marriage
:to copulate with
:to be marked or characterized by (a quality, attribute, or faculty) both have red hair has a way with words
:exhibit show had the gall to refuse
:use exercise have mercy on us
:to experience especially by submitting to, undergoing, or suffering I have a cold
:to make the effort to perform (an action) or engage in (an activity) have a look at that cut
:to entertain in the mind have an opinion
:to cause or command to do something used with the infinitive without to have the children stay
:to cause to be in a certain place or state has people around at all times
:allow we'll have no more of that
:to be competent in has only a little French
:to hold in a position of disadvantage or certain defeat we have him now
:to take advantage of :trick fool been had by a partner
:bear 2a have a baby
:to partake of have dinner have a piece
:bribe suborn can be had for a price

dt.un: used with the past participle to form the present perfect, past perfect, or future perfect has gone home had already eaten will have finished dinner by then

def.dt: :to be compelled, obliged, or required used with an infinitive with to or to alone we had to go do what you have to it has to be said
:would be wise to
:to go at or deal with :attack
:to deserve or merit what one gets, benefits by, or suffers he had that coming
:finish stop
:to bring to an end :have no further concern with let us have done with name-calling
:to have had or have done all one is going to be allowed to
:to have experienced, endured, or suffered all one can
:assert claim rumor has it that he was drunk
:to intend to do harm to
:to settle a matter of contention by discussion or a fight
:to refuse to have anything to do with
:to look at
:to watch constantly and attentively
:to have as an objective
:to deal with the story has to do with real people Alice M. Jordan
:to have a specified relationship with or effect on the size of the brain has nothing to do with intelligence Ruth Benedict
:one that is well-endowed especially in material wealth
:wear has on a new suit
:to trick or deceive intentionally :put on 5
:to have plans for what do you have on for tomorrow

entry.pr: ˈhadst, hədst, or t for d

entry.et: Middle English scrue, from Middle French escroe female screw, nut, from Medieval Latin scrofa, from Latin, sow

def.dt: :a simple machine of the inclined plane type consisting of a spirally grooved solid cylinder and a correspondingly grooved hollow cylinder into which it fits

:a nail-shaped or rod-shaped piece with a spiral groove and a slotted or recessed head designed to be inserted into material by rotating (as with a screwdriver) and used for fastening pieces of solid material together
:a screwlike form :spiral
:a turn of a screw
:a twist like the turn of a screw
:a screwlike device (as a corkscrew)
:a worn-out horse
:a small packet (as of tobacco)
:a prison guard
:a person who bargains shrewdly
:skinflint
:a propeller especially of a ship
:thumbscrew 1
:pressure or punitive measures intended to coerce used chiefly in the phrase put the screws on or put the screws to
:an act of sexual intercourse
:a partner in sexual intercourse
:to be mentally unbalanced
